website_summaries.verdict: These ratchet straps live up to their claims, and they're sure to fit easily into your budget.
pros: Ergonomic handle and smooth ratcheting action make straps easy to use
Hold gear securely without fraying or stretching out
cons: These straps do not come with instructions on how to use them properly

customer_reviews.title: I felt like a man using these
customer_reviews.text: Just bought a pickup truck. So obviously the first thing I had to do was help someone move... These worked great! I've used ratchet tie downs in the past that are a pain in the butt. These are easy to tighten and release and they hold very well. I tied down a bed, bed frame, headboard, and a large tv entertainment chest in my truck. Just for fun, and to annoy my gf, I took a rough way home. Nothing budged. 10/10 would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: These ratchet straps are amazing. I had no problem with them. I am a woman and pretty used to my husband doing everything for me, but he is deployed and I had to figure things out on my own for a 14 hour drive to my inlaws, from GA to TX. I strapped down a roof bag and these babies kept everything in tacked. My brother in law had to give me a quick run down how to used a ratchet strap, but all i needed was to be shown once. These were so simple and amazing quality. Will last a long time!
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Webbing broke!
customer_reviews.text: We just tried using (2) of these straps and the webbing on both SNAPPED! Imagine what would've happened if we trusted this on a load going down the highway at 55+MPH?! Now I will say we've bought these in the past and had nothing EVER go wrong with them. But (2) packaged together this time?!?!
customer_reviews.author: Robinson Vacuum Tanks

customer_reviews.title: Works like a dream!
customer_reviews.text: I love these! They came in a pack of 4 with the bonus 2 bungee cords as advertised! Very strong very durable! I piled 2 kayaks on my SUV used these to strap them down(and only these) and then had to go on the highway for an hour.....these worked perfectly, easy to take apart and put together and store. If I need anymore I'll be buying from AUGO.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonObsessed

customer_reviews.title: Rusts and breaks in 3 days
customer_reviews.text: This arrived last Thursday. Saturday I strapped kayaks and other stuff down to the trailer in the photo and we drove 8 hours from TN to NC beach. It rained once on the way there. When we arrived this is what the straps looked like, two had begun to fray or tear and one had rusted. I have another pair of ratchets from another company I need to find out who that are 10yrs old that aren’t even like these after 3 days. I’m returning these to find something else I have no idea how this has so many positive reviews and is recommended by amazon.
customer_reviews.author: J in TN

customer_reviews.title: Binding metal to metal
customer_reviews.text: I tried a couple of the 4 pack and they will ratchet and tighten BUT when you release the ratchet to loosen the straps there is a metal to metal binding of the mechanism . This is not the ratchet catching , but a tight binding you can tell is metal to metal . You have to grab with both hands and excessive force to get the slack to unhook and unwind the webbing for next use . Would return but maybe I can find some use for them . I would suggest you buy a different brand and source . BTW ,,,, I have used this type of strap for years so it is not operator error .
customer_reviews.author: C.D.

customer_reviews.title: Very good medium-weight ratchet straps
customer_reviews.text: I own and use lots of ratchet straps, everything from cheap 1" throw-aways to 2.5"x50' ulta-heavy duty. These are a completely serviceable mig-grade straps. The metal of the ratchet frames is medium weight, maybe 18ga, so I wouldn't trust these to valuable/critical loads but for my purpose, securing a 10x20 carport, they should be fine. I really like the quality of the soft-loops: these have the correct twist so that they lay flat, unlike some I have seen. Well worth the $22 and I would happily buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Don't Tie! Ratchet!!
customer_reviews.text: I probably should have ordered a second pack (4 in each pack plus 2 bungies) but they sure did the job for me and my brother! Work SO much better than rope. No tying...just ratchet them tight. Covered a lot of stuff in the moving van. Totally recommend this product. Oh, and the price was right!
customer_reviews.author: Claudia

customer_reviews.title: You better know how to make these work BEFORE you buy them!
customer_reviews.text: I'm an avid DIYer (Do-It-Yourselfer), & have actually designed my own tools! However, I couldn't get these darn things to work! I jammed 3 of them before I gave up. And yes - I read the instructions first. I bought them because of all of the + reviews, so obviously, others before me have been successful using them. Just not me! Bought a non-ratcheting set from Home Depot.
customer_reviews.author: Chris JungTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Worked for one trip
customer_reviews.text: To be fair, I drove across country from LA to PA with belongings strapped to the top of my ca. During the trip, one latch broke...I tied to together and bought some boungee cords to help keep items in place and prayed. But thankfully everything made it safely. The handles on 2 of them were damaged after the trip. Only one functioned appropriately afterwards. But based on how the other 3 held up, I tossed it too. I didnt want to chance that stress again. The bungee cords that came with the kit where even cheaper. None of them even made it half way....
customer_reviews.author: Holly1621

customer_reviews.title: 1 Year on and no problems
customer_reviews.text: As title says, I've had these guys for a year now with zero problems. Just don't use them for anything crazy and they will last. Keep within rating. Heaviest I use these for is using a single strap to secure about 500 pounds of water to my side by side to get back to the pigs on pasture. These haven't broke, frayed or shown any sign of weakness. I use them in sxs and truck for so many tasks. If these did break down the line, I would easily re-order these because they are cheaper than similarly rated ones at Tractor Supply and I have been quite pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Green

customer_reviews.title: Not for all applications
customer_reviews.text: The S hooks are not deep enough. With enough movement they slip off. I use these to secure a motorcycle onto a trailer. The bikes suspension has some movement in it and with enough movement the hooks release as mine did on a busy highway. I caught it in time and the three other straps somehow stayed in place. I am sure these work perfectly for most applications but a motorcycle trailer may be a little different. I replaced the S hooks with removable chain links and the problems is solved. These links cost as much as the straps.
customer_reviews.author: Dano

customer_reviews.title: Seem well-made, but instructions wrong
customer_reviews.text: Update: I bought a set in Jan. 2019, and am using it with an L-shaped hand truck. The hooks would be great to tie down a load in a pickup truck, but a plain strap would have been better for my purpose. The ratcheting instructions are appalling - it's not a language transation problem, because they're mostly diagrams, which are either misleading or plain wrong. Others may not have my problems, but I've never threaded a strap through a rachet before. I've only used ones that were already put together. However, the items seem solid, and I particularly like the 1" straps, which do less damage than the narrower ones that Amazon offers. Oh, and the price is right!
customer_reviews.author: Nigel R. Guest

customer_reviews.title: Load capacity of only 500 lbs is not good enough
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because of the price and hadn't thoroughly looked into the load capacity.. I was going for a budget friendly option that would work for carrying appliances in my truck bed securely and bought ahead of time, however, if you are looking for a one-and-done option, it'd be better to go ahead and invest in a heavy duty ratchet strap. I was even more dissatisfied when I saw a four pack of heavy duty straps for $21 dollars at Lowes the other day and bought a single 3000 lb break strength Husky heavy duty strap for $10 the other day (that is what I ended up using to carry the appliance on the 50+ mile journey).
customer_reviews.author: Smi_Gi

customer_reviews.title: Ratchet Tie-downs
customer_reviews.text: I have not completed my first use yet. Now I am about to trailer my new airplane home from Tennessee. Everything looks shipshape and is really snug. I really do not foresee any problems. Thank you so much for the speedy delivery. Okay..took wing off the airplane and placed it on a ladder rack made to the dimensions of my truck bed (and about a foot taller than the roof of my truck) and strapped it down. then placed the fuselage on my trailer and strapped the nose gear and the two main landing gear to "D" rings bolted to the trailer. Never a hint of a problem for the 170 mile trip. Thanks, these ratchet straps are absolutely great.
customer_reviews.author: Ned Webbley

customer_reviews.title: Strap It Down!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered to keep and use in my Truck. They seem of decent quality. I chose the soft strap option instead of the bungee cords. I haven't had a chance to use them yet, but when I do I update this review accordingly. So far, quality appears good, they came with instruction, which is great for anyone that has never used ratchet straps, and shipping was fast, even during a pandemic!. I'll keep ya'll posted.
customer_reviews.author: Thedual5s

customer_reviews.title: Be Careful
customer_reviews.text: During my initial familiarization, the ratchet was being very difficult to unwind. Pulling with both arms while depressing the release the unevenness of the release and my hand I inadvertently too close to the ratchet wheel resulted in a painful, bloody cut into the skin between my thumb and index finger. I find these tie downs much more difficult to use than others I have borrowed.
customer_reviews.author: jt

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend purchasing at Lowes or Home Depot where you can ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 packs of these for a trip out west and broke half of them along the way. After comparing the strap size of these to other 1500 lb straps that I have I am quite confident these are not as advertised. I would recommend purchasing at Lowes or Home Depot where you can inspect the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Weak metal
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like it. But after using one to strap down some metal parts together somehow the ratchet broke. It just broke. Where the spring and hinge,it bent and broke.i did not use much force. I usually get the dhx..? from home depot and have no issues strapping down huge panels really tight without issue. It feels like the metal is super thin for what it is intended for. I'll keep the other 3 for small jobs because I dont have time to return this.
customer_reviews.author: James woods forest

customer_reviews.title: As Advertised...  :)
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a specific purpose, but after trying them out I found that they wouldn't work. However, I did try to use them and they performed well. If you thread the strap properly and take a little care when ratcheting, there are no issues with tightening them and the straps don't seem to stretch significantly after tightening. I read a few of the people who had abrasion issues and those could be caused by not tightening the straps enough and having them rub on sharp corners. The straps themselves are not thick, but are as strong as advertised and will do the job if used properly and your load isn't allowed to shift around.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Happy with these - sturdy plastic-coated large hooks grab easily, you thread the long end through until it's just starting to tighten, then ratchet it up to very tight. There are TWO buttons to depress to unlatch it, and it takes a few times before you get this done smoothly. One of them, on the rotating barrel, is easier to deploy if you tighten the strap a quarter turn, then pull the tabs that release the "paul" that hold the barrel from rotating. This isn't a problem unless you've set the strap very tight and it's in a cramped spot that's hard to reach - easy lesson to learn and avoid the next time.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Elwood

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and well made
customer_reviews.text: These are very long, sturdy and feel durable. Easy to use too! The only tricky part was getting them out of the package. It would be easier with tin snips. But I used the long wire packaging ties to hold help organize the straps when not in use. Good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Well Hello

customer_reviews.title: Worked better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these ahead of time, knowing I would be hauling large lumber (2" x 12" x 16 feet) for a deck I was renovating for my daughter's home. I was concerned with the wood hanging out the back of my pickup and moving around during the drive and worried my bungee cords wouldn't be sufficient. These ratchet tie downs were strong and worked extremely well. They were easy to use and held all of that lumber together without a problem. Definitely will be using them again when I help my other daughter move into her new home. Definitely a great buy for me.
customer_reviews.author: Don S

customer_reviews.title: Ratchets work well but the straps feel a bit thin
customer_reviews.text: Ratchets work well but the straps feel a bit thin - this might just be cosmetic. I haven't had a problem with the straps breaking. I use the straps to secure my bicycles to the frame of my pick-up truck tray bed when travelling. They do the job, although it'd be good if there was an easier means of dealing with the long length of extra strap at the end. For the time being, I just use the wire strap tie that originally tied the straps to the packaging they came in. It does the job.
customer_reviews.author: CJBS

customer_reviews.title: Solid & Easy Smooth Action
customer_reviews.text: Can never have too many tie downs. Perhaps it is punishment for owning a truck (which is hardly driven), but everyone needs assistance with a purchase pick up etc these are a nice easy add, the action works well no issues. Nite. Don't have a pickup, know someone with a pickup. Then buy them these for the next time you need to pick up a sofa and tv.
customer_reviews.author: Larkson Rankor

customer_reviews.title: Good Value product, only minor hindrance due to design
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I'm very pleased with the value and utility of the product. It does what it says with little issue or complaint. From a design perspective, I have only see one flaw. the length of the ribbon strap on the ratchet side is quite short. If you are trying to hook into the back side of a c-channel or I beam, it will put the ratchet mechanism in an awkward situation. I'd personally like to see that length doubled there. As for durability, I can't complain so far, but have only used the devices for about half a dozen times. No issue to report so far. Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey P. Loudermilk

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality & Affordable Price
customer_reviews.text: These tie-down straps are perfect for carrying your paddle board or kayak on top of your car's roof rack. The straps are strong, double stitched for durability and come with an easy-to-use ratchet mechanism for tightening the straps for a firm and secure hold of the items on top the roof rack. The strap tension can be released easily by pushing the side buttons on the ratchet. The instructions for using the ratchet tensioner are sketchy and a bit difficult to follow. We are quite pleased with our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Gurudev

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: We wanted to keep our mattress instead of throwing it. We also didn’t want to leave in the basement because of molds and well, mattresses are pretty heavy. So we saw a Youtube video that taught us how to transport your mattress while moving houses... Bought this together with a mattress protector. And now, it’s stored perfectly in our spare room!
customer_reviews.author: Katrina

customer_reviews.title: These straps really do the job!
customer_reviews.text: These straps really do the job! Recently, I had to empty my mothers apartment, and my nephew helped me learn to use the straps. I had rented a van and filled it and then we had the dolly and hand truck, which we forgot to put in the van which was full! He secured those dollies and I made a 10 hour trip on the highway with absolutely no flapping are reveling of anything! I had never used them and had to focus to understand them, but once I did, they are extremely useful and an excellent addition to my tools...
customer_reviews.author: Deborah L.

customer_reviews.title: No Regrets On My Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: First set of tie downs that I’ve owned and I’ve used these about 15 times since the purchase. I’d be very surprised if you can get something better at this price point. I’ve moved large furniture, grills, and home gym equipment with these and I’ve never been nervous about the security of them. They’re very easy to setup and breakdown. My only wish is that they came in reusable packaging for storage. I know some trucks have compartments in bed for this stuff but mine unfortunately does not.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Wenzelburger

customer_reviews.title: Did the job and kept on holding. Still holding.
customer_reviews.text: Package is small and sturdy. Sat in back of car for over a year before I needed them. Have now abused and dropped these enough to say they pretty sturdy. Not rattled loose or bent out of shape. Ratchet grabs just as good now as when new. Some corrosion, but I live near the beach and saltwater is life. Release bar can be difficult, but they were holding a lot of strain. Straps are fuzzy with age but not fraying. All four systems have survived intact and still 100% usable.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent straps, easy on my hands
customer_reviews.text: After a cross-country move, I am a fan of these straps. I used two brands, and while both kept my stuff secure, I found these much easier to release when it came time to unpack. This is a big deal for me, as I have very small hands, and at my age must work to avoid joint pain. I'd definitely buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: F. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and Durable!
customer_reviews.text: I got these with the loops to help strap my wife’s kayak down to our SUV’s roof. I had two crossbars to work with so I put 4 loops on, placed the kayak, and ran the ratchet straps across the front and back and hooked onto the loops. Although I was a first timer with ratchet straps, they were very easy to use. The locking mechanism is strong and pretty much leaves no doubt in their security. Straps stayed completely tight over a 45 min trip up the highway. Thing didn’t move! Loosening was really smooth. Now I just keep them tucked away in the back of the SUV for rainy day. They definitely prove their worth!
customer_reviews.author: HopShot

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and dependable
customer_reviews.text: This four pack of straps was the perfect last minute solution to an unexpected move. Combined with a handtruck (and a few helpful friends), I was able to pack up and move my office without hiring a moving company. I hadn’t used the ratchet straps before but they were easy to figure out how to use and critical to the effort. I used them to hold the file cabinets and furniture to the handtruck down a flight of stairs and again to hold the materials down in the pickup truck for the 15 minute drive to my new office.
customer_reviews.author: scarlet pimple

customer_reviews.title: Tell you more when I get it out!!
customer_reviews.text: I will come back and tell you more about the product when I manage to extricate it! Very poor planning on this. The twist ties used to hold them in place are difficult to undo. The sturdy base they attached to make me shake my head as they could have designed it slightly different to allow it to be a carry case. Instead, it is useless. If this had just been cheap, flimsy backing I would not have cared but as it is, I think it's wasteful.
customer_reviews.author: LadyPegasus

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to leave a review!
customer_reviews.text: I've had these for over a year and a half now, never got around to writing a proper review until now. The reason I bothered to write a review at all is because of the awesome customer service. one of my units straps was frayed on arrival, I emailed the seller and was shipped a replacement the next day (after providing picture of damage). Very happy with how I was treated. Now 2nd benefit of waiting before a review is that I have been able to use these in heat, cold, wet, dry etc and they have perform 10/10 would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Used this to strap down 2 suitcases on our roof for our drive from Las Vegas to Disneyland. Worked pretty well but the hooks were too thick to fit in the holes provided by my SUVs roof rack. Had to tightly hook them just to the bars and pray. But they didn’t move at all. Both ways no problem. The instructions were a little weak. Having never worked a system like this before, I ended up just looking up a video on youtube to learn how it worked.
customer_reviews.author: Wilhelm

customer_reviews.title: Country of Origin Obfuscated
customer_reviews.text: The country of origin is written so tiny on the packaging you need a magnifying glass to read it. I think if you choose a country to manufacture your product in, you should make a decision you can be proud of, not try to HIDE it. I say this as someone who has had my own products manufactured in China before, and I don't try to hide it, because I know if the product is really good quality, then the buyer won't care so much where it's made.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Affordable price, sturdy hold, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good little product. Harkened new back to my Logistics days in the AF. Pretty easy and intuitive to strap and pretty sturdy for household and personal vehicular needs. I wouldn’t recommend for cargo pallets but they work pretty well for securing my kids’ swing set legs and also work well for securing furniture in a truck bed that was too long to close the tailgate. Affordable price, sturdy hold, easy to use!
customer_reviews.author: Erin Beeler Loesch

customer_reviews.title: Read the directions
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to secure boards. I opened the package, threw aside the instructions, and busily went to work. The first problem I ran into was that the hooks did not fit my truck (2000 f150). No problem. I got some carabiners. The next problem was 100% my fault. I did not read the instructions and I should have. I basically attached it backwards so the tie down could not tighten. Turns out ratcheting is not as simple as you think. Once I read the instructions, everything worked fine. Take time and read instructions. Delivery was fast so that was good.
customer_reviews.author: TR

customer_reviews.title: Good value and top notch seller.
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent quality for the price, and AUGO sent them quickly as well. Even the packaging of the product showed that the manufacturer didn't cut corners. And the additional straps included will be great for holding down items with bars or handlebars such as bicycles, motorcycles, lawn mowers etc - those items where you want to wrap around for stability without hurting the paint job. Overall an excellent seller and hope to do business with AUGO again. Thanks AUGO for an excellent product and excellent service!
customer_reviews.author: Marleen beader

customer_reviews.title: Need longer leads on the ratchet side of strap, need bigger hooks for car racks.  Strong hold !
customer_reviews.text: Straps were strong and held the mattress to the roof of my car for 700 miles. It took a bit of fiddling to get a secure hold. 1 the hooks are not big enough for a roof rack so we had to secure them inside the car using the pull bar under the seat. For the ratchet part of the strap if this would have been a bit longer it would have given us more flexibility as it’s only about 5inches long. The tied down strap is super long and saved the day with its eye hole security configuration. All in all the straps held great once we found places to secure them too.
customer_reviews.author: Ulmeen

customer_reviews.title: The straps appear to be of surprisingly good quality. The hooks and handles have a good ...
customer_reviews.text: The straps appear to be of surprisingly good quality. The hooks and handles have a good feel with a good hard clicking sound. I am not afraid to crank the straps too far like some cheaper ones. Initial impressions are good, but only time will tell how they hold up. The free bungees are a nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Kornfeld

customer_reviews.title: Worked for me
customer_reviews.text: Works fantastic to secure my 200lbs electric wheelchair to the hitch carrier on the back of my car. I went on a 8 hour roadtrip with these and the chair didn't even shift. The only thing to note is that the instructions are useless if you've never used rachet straps. I recommend watching YouTube videos that show you how to use a rachet clamp
customer_reviews.author: Gina P

customer_reviews.title: Great for all things
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure these are good for a lot of different applications. I'm using two of these at tie downs for my basketball goal. I bought four ten inch screw anchors for the ground and with two of these straps that goal isn't going anywhere. I've never bought ratchet straps for any type of reason, now I have a couple extra to use when need. For what I'm using them for they are working out great.
customer_reviews.author: J-RodTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Bad first impression
customer_reviews.text: I buy new stuff. Looks like I got a return item. None of the straps were in the packaging. It was all loose in the box. Pitiful first experience seeing it this way. I haven't used it yet but they seem to work. My Rhino set I got the same day was perfectly packaged.
customer_reviews.author: WV

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I can't really speak to their longevity, as I've only had them up for a few days, but so far they've managed to do exactly what I wanted them to do. I'm using them to a anchor a 10' x 20' shade structure, and coincidentally they had to stand up to some extremely heavy wind and rain immediately after I in stalled them. So far they've held tight and taught with minimal adjustments. I'm optimistic about they're ability to keep things battened down in the high winds of the Black Rock Desert come Burning Man.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Nuttle

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use ratchet tie downs
customer_reviews.text: Good deal for a 4pk. These are easy to use. I'm a woman and I use it to strap my bikes down in my truck bed or bike rack. The hook are ripped in rubber, so they won't scratch and the strap are very long, good length. There are no security features, they don't lock nor can you put a padlock on the straps. If you're locking your bike, use a chain or bike lock. These are only to tie cargo down.
customer_reviews.author: Cali girl

customer_reviews.title: Works for large loads
customer_reviews.text: Thes work well for large loads but not very well for small loads. I needed to be able to tightent the ratchet the width of my pickup bed and it couldn't tighten thenat short a distance. Over long diatnces it works well as long as about half the length only is pulled up on the racthet spool. AFter that it slips and will not ratchet anymore. It looks like the webbing hits the frame and isn;t allowed to go anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Ratchet locks up
customer_reviews.text: If I'm rating this just for being straightforward, like any other ratcheting tie down, this works just fine. The problem with this product, is the ratchet often locks up. Granted, it's only during the action of tying down your load and doesn't malfunction while under tension. It just takes a bit of banging it on something for it to reengage the gears. The sides also cave in a bit and often aren't parallel like they should be.
customer_reviews.author: Dave C

customer_reviews.title: Very useful and well made.
customer_reviews.text: I now have two of these tie down straps in each of our SUVs. The straps are much longer than I need to tie down cargo in the luggage compartment of an average sized SUV. However, I figured out a way to feed the long strap in such a way that does not bind or hamper the release mechanism. Of course, the strap can always be cut to a shorter length. The longer length is necessary for tying larger cargo on a roof rack. Coated hooks help protect the vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Colin

customer_reviews.title: They work
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you pull the straps as tight as they can go before you begin ratcheting. The spool can only hold so much, and if you overflow it then the strap will either get pinched or become too thick to ratchet anymore. I wish the width of the strap was a bit wider so that they wouldn't dig into my soft items quite so much.
customer_reviews.author: Mark P

customer_reviews.title: Work great for holding kayaks
customer_reviews.text: We use these to hold kayaks down on the vehicle! They are strong and sturdy and easy to use
customer_reviews.author: jenxtar

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money but...
customer_reviews.text: This ratchet strap is a good deal for the money. The "S" hooks are smaller than the set I am replacing. Being smaller, the hook often drops out of the anchor point in bed. That is before I get a chance to tension the ratchet on the other end. Have to walk back around and re-hook. So my next set will have the spring loaded keeper to keep the hook engaged. I hope this review helps.
customer_reviews.author: RSL1

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware!
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used these straps one of the straps (which I tied up the excess) broke completely off behind where the excess was tied, shortening the strap considerably. Another, unraveled in the middle of the strap and is unusable. One of the ratchets came completely apart. They were only tightened down enough to hold a refrigerator in place, this SHOULD NOT have happened. I would send them back but it has been a little while since I ordered them. I would DEFINITELY NOT recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: law

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product,
customer_reviews.text: These ratchet straps are an excellent deal for the price. Follow the directions and you’ll be rigging loads like a pro. You can easily crush things ratching down, be careful! The handy wall rack really needs to be mounted on a wall. I can’t find even the smallest reachable space to hang it so every time I pick it up everything falls out the back of the rack. I really need to find a spot.
customer_reviews.author: pipeguy

customer_reviews.title: Well made, strong and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Used all 4 of the hold down straps this weekend moving 2 beds in my pickup. Even with strong cross winds there was never a problem. The straps are strong and easy to use. I especially like the rubber coated handle and release bar.
customer_reviews.author: Phid

customer_reviews.title: Amazing straps
customer_reviews.text: The straps are durable, very well made. I am sure they are easy enough to use, myself this was the first time I used this type of tie down, with the instructions I managed to figure it out. I used to tie down my mobility scooter on the back of my car with a scooter ramp. I felt pretty safe knowing driving on the highway the scooter was well strapped in.
customer_reviews.author: PFitz

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for securing furniture in pickup
customer_reviews.text: I had taken a load of furniture from a friend moving to California. This was a one day one way trip and I had to be on the highway as it was 30 miles from my house. I had furniture stacked like Fred Sanford, these straps worked great and really kept things tight. Easy to use and great deal for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Rankin

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: I like to wait until I know for sure things work. Having now used them a few times, great purchase for the price point. I didn't and don't need anything any bigger than this (for now and the foreseeable future) and they're great. The two bungees it comes with are fantastic as well. Great way to hold down some of my fishing gear and groceries in the bed of my truck. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Terrance

customer_reviews.title: nothing as good for tie-downs
customer_reviews.text: I've found Ratchet straps are by far the best way to secure boats, motorcycle, canoes, to a trailer behind my truck, or thing in the truck bed. They will also work great on passenger vehicles as long as you make sure no metal parts will bump or scratch the paint from normal motion going over bumps etc. These were a great deal, too, half of what I would have paid in a brick and mortar joint
customer_reviews.author: Pete in NY

customer_reviews.title: Does what I bought it for- hold a kayak on top of car
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to hold down a kayak on top of my Subaru. Even though it’s the end of the season-so far so good! The bungees cords are an added plus for the front and rear of the kayak.
customer_reviews.author: Mtrio

customer_reviews.title: Good ties, but familiarize yourself with how they operate
customer_reviews.text: Our daughter was moving out of state so we bought ratchet tie-downs to secure her stuff. It took us about a half hour to load the pickup and an hour to tie everything down. In part it took an hour because we were unfamiliar with how ratchet ties work. Besides that we were fighting the straps folding as we were trying to cinch them. Another factor was the hooks in the truck bed were positioned very low which made it cumbersome to secure with a hook on a 6” or so lead. The quality of the ties appear to be satisfactory.
customer_reviews.author: 95437 shopper

customer_reviews.title: New ones not as good as old ones
customer_reviews.text: I've bought (3) sets of 4 of these in the last 5 years. The metal is the same, but the nylon strap material on the last set is thinner that the material used on the first (2) sets. I guess companies can't live with success, have to cut corners to make a nickel more on a product. I would have given them 5 stars except for the thinner material.
customer_reviews.author: Florida Pine Island Tree Farm

customer_reviews.title: Good straps but smaller (narrower) than they look
customer_reviews.text: These are good quality straps that work well. The width of the straps is not stated in the listing on Amazon and I was a bit disappointed when I saw that they are only just over an inch wide; I had anticipated wider straps. I kept them though because they do work fine; I just need to pick up some wider ones as well.
customer_reviews.author: SpaceRanger

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRICE AND PRODUCT FOR MEDIUM LOADS
customer_reviews.text: WORKS WELL FOR GENERALLY USE , AS A TIE DOWN AND LOAD STABILIZER THESE WILL WORK FINE , OVERALL A NICE SET OF THIS PRICE POINT , FOR HEAVY LOADS OR HIGH SECURITY TIE DOWN , I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS PARTICULAR PRODUCT , THAT'S NOT TO SAY I DO NOT LIKE THIS PRODUCT , AS I DO , BUT ONLY WHEN APPLIED PROPERLY TO THE RIGHT SIZE LOAD FOR THEIR DURABILITY.
customer_reviews.author: MR ED

customer_reviews.title: Good for the long haul -First Time User
customer_reviews.text: These AUGO Ratchet straps are good for the long haul. These were the first time I ever used ratchet straps. I used these on a recent round-trip to TN from Wash. DC. Once I put the straps on I did not need to adjust or tighten them during the trip. The length of the straps makes it easy to put on and take off. These will definitely be used again for my next trip.
customer_reviews.author: D. Shadow

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use and Durable.
customer_reviews.text: I liked how easy it was to use these. I've used my fair share of similar Ratchet Tie Downs, but these were one of the easier to actually tie down. The straps seem rather durable and the color was easy to keep an eye on as we passed through the mountains while moving some heavy furniture up north for our parents. Held down the antique dressers and cabinet really well. I definitely prefer these over rope given the opportunity. I hate tying and untying knots. I'm certainly keeping this set for myself for future moves and projects.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Hubble

customer_reviews.title: Well made and sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: I am really pleased with the Ratchet Tie Down Straps. They are well made and sturdy. I purchased them to use along with bungee cords to secure the cover on my boat for the winter. The bungees only last through 1 winter, and I know the tie downs are going to last a lot longer. I was able to attach them so they won’t scratch the boat when it’s windy. I highly recommend these ratchet tie downs.
customer_reviews.author: Susan E. Flammer

customer_reviews.title: Saved our butts and boxes
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to help my parents move across a few states. It was a little difficult to figure out how to properly use them and not get tangled, but once we had that figured out, they were very sturdy and kept everything in place in the trailer. Three days and 900+ miles later we opened the trailer to find not one box fell out of place.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Not much to write about this product it's exactly what it's supposed to do it's dirty strong easy to set up the give a lot of extra cable so you can wrap a long long loads worked out great for me and my truck I'll need it too and now I have to spare for emergencies pricing was decent definitely would consider purchasing in the future
customer_reviews.author: My

customer_reviews.title: No Worries Overhead!
customer_reviews.text: This product was bought to secure an overhead bullet-shaped luggage carrier for our trip to Disney World this Christmas. I chose this set over a well-known popular brand because of the reviews. We were extremely pleased with how it worked to secure the bullet. Everything stayed in place making one less thing we had to worry about! Would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: Purchasing transaction was smooth and trouble free. Product I received was what I ordered and I am grateful for the soft loop option as opposed to the bungees. Inspected all four straps and build quality looks to be good. I'll be securing a step latter in the bed of my truck so I can climb up with a tree-trimming chain saw and clear branches hanging into out lane, so I'll let you know if any of them break! I know ... stupid man trick that leads to fatal accident ... but it seems so simple! I'll return and lower the stars if I discover any manufacturing defects. Otherwise, I'm feeling pretty good about this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Understandably Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Complicated...
customer_reviews.text: They are heavy duty but I had a problem feeeding them I had them all tangled up! I was very discouraged and would have sent them back, I only opened two but was evacuated from my house do to the Carr Fire and when I got back two and a half weeks later the window for a return had closed so I’m stuck with them... The next ones I buy will be from a store so I can see that what I’m buying isn’t complicated...
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl Markle

customer_reviews.title: Great ratchet straps for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to go with the spiral ground stakes I bought for our new trampoline. I chose them because of the average rating sand the price. They were fantastic quality, work exactly as they should, and had some features the more expensive last set I bought (different brand & vendor) didn't have. I'd definitely buy these again when I need more straps.
customer_reviews.author: Justin T.

customer_reviews.title: Great Tie down Straps
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my boyfriend as a gift for his new pickup truck. He loves them and uses them often. These are exactly as pictured: sturdy ratchet tie downs in a nice bright blue color. Would totally recommend this item
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Ramella

customer_reviews.title: Secure and Easy to Use!
customer_reviews.text: We used these to secure a soft car topper for a three day trip across the US! They were wonderful and everything arrived safely. A little difficult to set up at first if you are not familiar with ratchet straps, but I learned quickly and would definitely buy these again. I also loved that the set came with extra bungee cords, as those were useful to keep everything secure inside the over-filled car!
customer_reviews.author: Courtney LeMay

customer_reviews.title: these are great
customer_reviews.text: These are as sturdy as you would hope they are. Great price, great product. I don't know weight but I've moved some heavy object using this and a hand truck with no issues at all.
customer_reviews.author: Geoff

customer_reviews.title: Tough Straps That Worked Well For My Move
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a move in a Uhaul. They are not as wide as other straps but we're durable and held things tight. I only found one flaw which I will state below: My only complaint is that the short side strap was just a hair too short too be wrapped around the wooden rub rails to self support that side. I had to simply run the strap around and "double the strap" to hold the furniture. If there had been hooks in the Uhaul, this would not have been an issue. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Hill

customer_reviews.title: Hard to use, but works well!
customer_reviews.text: Not so easy to figure out how to use. Still struggling but when I do happen to get them strapped down correctly somehow, they work great!! It think if you have experience with these type of tie downs, you’ll have no trouble but for a first time user, plan some time to figure them out.
customer_reviews.author: MNTMAMA

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for trampoline wind straps
customer_reviews.text: Got these and some steaks to use for wind straps for our trampoline. They work amazing. We had some extreme winds with the temperature change and the trampoline (in an open field) didnt budge. They are way too long, but I just tied the extra strap to the feet of the trampoline so they didnt dangle around.
customer_reviews.author: EmmaJean

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for most tasks
customer_reviews.text: Im not sure how long these will last as the material is thin. They don’t appear to be for everyday use but would probably last a while for a weekend warrior. These take a while to setup and require just a little patience. Depending on how much length you want to keep, trimming may be required. The ratchets are of so/so build quality, not heavy duty
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Strong
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to transport a garden tractor 120 miles, and bring another back the two hour drive. I was [pulling a rental trailed that had nice sturdy tie down rings, and these straps prohibited the tractors from moving an inch out of place, despite driving over washboard roads, bumpy, pot-holed downtown streets and the interstate.
customer_reviews.author: Gregjax Fl

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product very cheap doesn't hold Anythink
customer_reviews.text: I've only had them a couple weeks and two of them have already broken all I did was strapped an 8-foot ladder one of them bent while tightening it not over-tightening it the other one I thought was working but it let loose on my ladder fell off on the highway not a very good product very disappointed don't think I'm even going to try to use another one going back to my old ones
customer_reviews.author: Bruce young

customer_reviews.title: Excellent holding power!!!!
customer_reviews.text: These straps are easy to use and hold things in place! They really got the job done that I needed. They hold things in place even when they are struggling. I would reccomend and will DEFINITELY be buying more soon!! PS. My wife is making me add this section. Everything above was sarcasm and just a joke. I would never use ratchet straps for holding someone down. That's what duct tape is for!!
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: One of the better deals for ratchet straps on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: One of the better deals for ratchet straps on Amazon. The extra loops included are lifesavers. Ratchets work great, but the straps are not the most durable. Definitely had some straps that got frayed or cut on the edges during normal use. They'll get the job done but don't use them for any professional, regular use.
customer_reviews.author: LittleJoe

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect, and just what I was looking for. They (so far) appear to be sturdy and reliable. I just them to help strap my boat to the trailer, so I need sturdy and reliable. 4 of them for this price, I think it's probably the best bet out there. Quite pleased, thx
customer_reviews.author: Kerry.

customer_reviews.title: love them
customer_reviews.text: they work great, are strong, feel well made. it took me a little while to figure out how to use them, even with the instructions they come with, but now that I finally understand, I use them for everything. delightfully long, can use to hold my car trunk closed when i'm transporting stuff that needs to stick out the back. highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality straps that work like they should!
customer_reviews.text: These are well built straps. I have been using poor quality straps that bind up and impossible to release. These straps made a huge difference and are easy to ratchet tight and easy to release. The straps are thicker and better quality than previous straps I've used. Thank you !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks just like the one in ACE hardware for half the price.
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased with my purchase. They arrived on time, I was able to lock down some furniture as well as materials for some building (two different trips) using a smaller crossover SUV because these straps held down the hatch. I was pleasantly surprised with the quality of the products, as some of the stuff you get online can feel pretty cheap. This AUGO ratchet strap set seems pretty durable. I went to ACE hardware the other day for some miscellaneous items and walked past their ratchet straps. They were almost double the price for something that looked exactly the same. Definitely worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Belinda Gloyd

customer_reviews.title: They came in a 4 pack
customer_reviews.text: I have a large glue up project that make the use of bar clamps difficult. I was told to use ratchet strap tie down. When ordering I chose these because of the length, weight they would support and width. Color was not a factor. These ratchet tie downs fit the bill. Best they were offered in multi packs. Now get back to my project and put these good looking tie down to work.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry 73

customer_reviews.title: Solid Quality
customer_reviews.text: Got a set of these to go with my new truck. They seem to be a quality product (no loose seems or frays yet). I'm replacing an old set, so it's nice to have the plastic covers over the release. Overall, they look like they are going to hold up well with my occasional use for them. If I was going to use them often, I might be looking for a sturdier set. But, I would say they are a great deal for what you pay.
customer_reviews.author: L. Dowiot

customer_reviews.title: Great for light-mid loads
customer_reviews.text: I got these right after getting my truck cause I had some stuff to haul and knew I would be “the friend with a truck.” Sure enough, in the first two weeks I hauled a dryer, two stoves, several junk loads, and about ~800lbs of lumber, all secured with these straps. Even connecting them to proper tie-down points in my truck bed, the rubber coating on the hooks is starting to rub off, but the straps and ratchet are holding up well and are simple to use. If you rely heavily on ratchet straps often these might not last long, but for a casual tool to keep in your truck or trailer these are a great option.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Morawe

customer_reviews.title: Good product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these tie down straps to secure luggage on my new Thule cargo rack. They are very sturdy and strong! The only thing is that the hooks are not big enough to get around the largest tubes of the cargo rack. You can make do by hooking onto the smaller diameter crossbars, but it is the one thing that I wish was different. Also, it is worth practicing the method to loosen the ratchet a few times before use. Otherwise, all in all, a fantastic product!
customer_reviews.author: CN

customer_reviews.title: Work well so far...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these ratchet straps to permanently hold 55 gallon barrels steady in my bus bays while driving. I haven't driven more than 100 miles so far with them so I can't say anything about the long term durability of these straps but I am hoping for the best since having 450 pound barrels lying on their sides and rolling around isn't a fun thing especially if they are filled with human waste. I bought these straps because they were within my budget and exceeded the worse case load rating for my need, but I HATE ratchet straps like these in general because the standard design, like these are, isn't efficient or user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Most important moving tool for DIY move
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 packs of these for a DIY move cross country. Had several large items, w/d, furniture items including a piano. So grateful we had these ratchets - and bonus bungee cords which were included in the package. They were easy to use, sturdy and held the items securely.
customer_reviews.author: busyliving

customer_reviews.title: They didn't hold
customer_reviews.text: We bought 2 sets for our move. They are cheaply made and kept slipping. At the end of the move, the S hooks looked like they were chewed up and where the strap is connected was frayed. They are being returned.
customer_reviews.author: Linda S.

customer_reviews.title: One time use product
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. Straps are very thin and prone to abrasion. I was looking for cheap throw away straps and this is what I got. One strap did not make the first trip. Ended up putting socks and other misc cloth under the remaining straps to eliminate any possible chaffing. Usually you need to protect the cargo, not the strap!
customer_reviews.author: JONATHAN

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE !!
customer_reviews.text: They seemed like most others you see, but now I would not recommend these. The first time I used them one strap broke and one ratchet jammed and this was not under conditions that they shouldn't work. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: GMAN

customer_reviews.title: Many uses
customer_reviews.text: I have used these for many uses and have never had any issues. I have transported ladders on my car, tying up a christmas tree in the attic, and other stuff. It is very easy to assemble and use. The cables are durable and I have not noticed any issues since I bought them a few months ago.
customer_reviews.author: Dominic

product_meta.title: Ratchet Tie Down Straps - 4 Pk - 15 Ft- 500 Lbs Load Cap- 1500 Lb Break Strength- Cambuckle Alternative- Cargo Straps for Moving Appliances, Lawn Equipment, Motorcycle - Includes 2 Bungee Cord
feature_bullets: HIGH QUALITY RATCHET TIE DOWN STRAPS – Travel with peace of mind if you've got the top rated industrial grade AUGO tie down straps!
RUBBER COATED "S" HOOKS - Prevent your cargo and vehicle from being scratched!
ERGONOMIC HANDLES ARE MOLDED ON – AUGO has unique molding technology. Our handles will never fall off!
ADJUST TO THE SIZE OF YOUR CARGO – 15 ft. of webbing will securely hold big or small loads!
TWO AUGO BUNGEE CORDS – Comes in handy. Added for your convenience!

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars5,224 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
